column4: I just installed Ubuntu on a friends' laptop, and the fan just keeps going al the time
it's really loud and annoying, is there a quick fix I can do to keep the fan noise down?
like, if there's a cfig file that sets the cpu settings, or the fan settings
or if maybe there's an app I can install that monitors the settings, and alows me to turn it on and off as needed?
there should be cpu driver installed for the laptop model
for example, I have powernow_k8 on my turion-based laptop
where would I look for that, and how can I use the driver to change the fan settings?
lsmod|grep cpu first
ok, there's 5 results, shall I pastebin them?
yes
http://paste.ubuntu.com/56652/
I see no cpu driver there. what is the make of laptop?
Compaq Presario 3000
it's kind of old
looks like you also need powernow-k8
would powernowd suffice?
AFAIK no. check http://badcomputer.org/unix/compaqr3000.bot
and try modprobe powernow-k8
ah, because I apt-cache searched pwernow and it came up with powernowd which seems to be a cpu speed controller
I do not remember myself installing powernow-k8 - perhaps it was there already. try modprobe...
k
